chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M. Hykes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas M. Hykes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas M. Hykes was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $2000 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Required to work full time.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP, DOC-2259.  Def. has successfully completed the Earned Release Program on 5/13/16.  It is ordered that DOC effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  The number of days converted from confinement time to extended supervision will be determined by DOC and be based upon actual release date.
Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge
5 yrs WSP; 2 yrs Initial followed by 3 yrs ES.  Not eligible for CIP, but eligible for SAP

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Count 1 - DE is sentenced to 5 years in the WSP forthwith; 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision.  Credit for 128 days.  Court imposes a fine of $2000 plus costs to be paid during supervision.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Driving privileges are revoked for 3 years.  AODA Assessment & Ignition Interlock is ordered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2 & 3 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 9/2/15 at 10:30 AM.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: File sent to Br 3 for subst

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Kristyne Watson. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Watson. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 7-2-15 @ 8:30am. Bond continued.
of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Watson. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman.

1:32  Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matt Perz. Clerk LE  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 5-6-15 @ 9:15 am. $7500.00 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.  *No Contact w/ Christi K or her residence.
